net.parallaxed.bluejam
Class NoteLeaf

java.lang.Object
  net.parallaxed.bluejam.Note
      net.parallaxed.bluejam.NoteLeaf
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, NoteSequence, Saveable, Terminal
public class NoteLeaf
extends Note
implements NoteSequence, java.lang.Cloneable, Terminal, Saveable

Implements a unary note-sequence (only one note in the sequence) NoteLeaf instances extend the functionality of Note, such that it can be added and manipulated within a NoteTree. It is part of the default BlueJam implementation. Instances of this class can be manipulated in the same way as a note sequences, to add more notes (branch off) or swap itself. This class also implements Terminal, inferring that it can be part of a terminal set, and that when added to a NoteTree, the leaf is only manipulable within the bounds given by it's lockMask. Note that a Terminal on a NoteTree can only be condensed by having it's parent swapped out, it cannot be removed, only cleared (or "rested"). Consider NoteLeaf interning by using a HashMap over the heap.

See Also:
NoteSequence, Note

Field Detail

id

public int id
This public identifier is only used when building note trees to describe notes that may be paired into swing partners, or have trails between them. Can also be used in NoteCollections to identify notes.

mutable

protected byte mutable
Defines whether or not the note is complete, and if not, which properties are mutable. The mutability is a bitmask that is AND'ed with the MUTABLE constants to decide if that property is changeable. If a note is incomplete, it is probably in a heuristic tree and has values that have not been filled. When a note is marked incomplete, the pitch (pitchClass and octave) of the note may be changed.

_parent

public NoteTree _parent
This should be set by the add() methods in NoteTree.

swapNotes

public boolean swapNotes(NoteSequence swapOut,
                         NoteSequence swapIn)
                  throws NoteAddException
NoteLeaves do not support swapping - this should be done by NoteTree's (i.e. the _parent)

Specified by:
swapNotes in interface NoteSequence
Parameters:
swapOut - First argument to swap
swapIn - Second argument to swap
Throws:
NoteAddException
See Also:
NoteTree

addNotes

public boolean addNotes(NoteSequence notes)
Transforms this NoteLeaf into a NoteTree. Supports only the addition of NoteLeafs, therefore NoteSequences of size 1 only. The note currently on this leaf will split and accept one note in the given NoteSequence as it's child, if the rhythm for that NoteSequence is valid at this depth.

Specified by:
addNotes in interface NoteSequence
Returns:
True on success, false on failure.

removeNotes

public void removeNotes(NoteSequence notes)
This method simply sets the parent to null, if the passed NoteSequence == this. NB: the parent should erase this child (leaving a null gap in the children array). The function call passed to this node should simply be a signal to get ready and GC the note.

Specified by:
removeNotes in interface NoteSequence
Parameters:
notes - The NoteSequence to remove

public Note getNote()

getValue

public int getValue()
Returns a unique signed integer for this note (the MIDI note number), or -1 if this note is relative. This method is used for building TerminalSets

Specified by:
getValue in interface Terminal
Returns:
A unique identifier assigned by the implementing object.

swingNote

public void swingNote(int swingPercent,
                      int swingPartnerId)
Used when building trees to assign a swing partner to this NoteLeaf at a later time. swingPartnerId will be used to assign this.swingPartner

Parameters:
swingPercent - The amount to swing this note
swingPartnerId - The ID of the paired note

validateNotes

public void validateNotes()
                   throws ValidationException
Validates this NoteSequence. This method validates the note and throws the right kind of exception if anything is awry. For some reason this method uses lazy evaluation to optimize screen real-estate.

lockMask

public void lockMask(int lockMask)
              throws ValidationException
Will perform the appropriate lock operations given the passed mask. If the operation cannot be performed due to validation inconsistencies, this method will swallow the exception and forward it to an active display.

Parameters:
lockMask - A non-negative integer
Throws:
ValidationException

lockAll

protected void lockAll()
                throws ValidationException
Deprecated. 

Attempts to lock all note properties and make the note immutable - if this fails, an exception thrown explaining which properties are invalid. This is arbitrary, no validation takes place here. Subclasses must override these methods to provide correct validation.

Throws:
ValidationException - if the note cannot be locked

clone

public NoteLeaf clone()
If supported, this should return a copy of this NoteSequence independent from the original. This should be used mainly when an implementation wants to produce children or copies of itself. Heuristics use this method to return copies of themselves which can then be mutated. NB The proper way to do this would involve a call to super.clone()

Specified by:
clone in interface NoteSequence
Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
A copy of this NoteSeqeunce
